page.title: 16SPEECH IN ARLEY & LOCALITY
page.content: Strangers to the area may think that the local accent is similar to the local Birmingham one. However,although the outskirts of the city aren't far away many families have there roots in Durham,Scotland and S.Wales.There are a few local dialect phrases such as: ye sen:yourself me sen:myself e gus:he goes soz:sorry These may not be peculiar to the locality.These places though wouldn't be recognised on a walk in the area. the Burma :Fir Tree Lane the Furnie :Arbury Estate Wood Fatty's Wood :N.C.B. Woodland the Ford :Stockingford(nearby) the Piv :the cricket pavillion the Jampot :Arley W.M.C. Arley & locality may have been an area of immigration,but regional dialects don't seem to have combined to form a distinct Arley dialect.
